intro: Sebaea woodii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful if ingested. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture. Sebaea woodii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments.
